title: North Carolina Primary Early Voting Nears End
summary: Early voting for North Carolina's primary elections ends Saturday at 3 p.m. Residents can decide key races.
charlotte_impact: The primary elections will shape the political landscape of North Carolina, influencing future policies and representation.

title: East Charlotte Shooting Leaves One Critically Injured
summary: An overnight shooting in the 6500 block of E W.T. Harris Boulevard critically injured one person.
charlotte_impact: This incident highlights ongoing concerns about violent crime and public safety in certain areas of Charlotte.

title: Warmer, Springlike Weather Forecasted for Weekend
summary: After morning fog clears, Charlotte is expected to experience nicer, springlike weather this weekend.
charlotte_impact: Positive weather can improve community morale and facilitate outdoor activities after a period of colder weather.

title: I-485 Express Lanes Open in Charlotte
summary: The I-485 Express Lanes in south Charlotte are now open, offering a faster route between I-77 and U.S. 74.
charlotte_impact: The new express lanes aim to alleviate traffic congestion and improve transportation efficiency in the area.

title: Woman Dies After Assault in East Charlotte
summary: A woman has died weeks after being assaulted in east Charlotte. A suspect is in custody as of Feb. 27, 2026.
charlotte_impact: This tragic event underscores the severity of violent crime and its lasting impact on victims and the community.

title: Couple Accused of Assaulting 1-Year-Old in Burke County
summary: A mother and her boyfriend are accused of assaulting a 1-year-old, causing a fractured arm, according to court records.
charlotte_impact: Child abuse cases are a serious concern, requiring intervention to protect vulnerable children and ensure their safety.

title: CMPD Targets Charlotte Crime Hotspots with 'Queen City Safe' Patrols
summary: CMPD is launching 'Queen City Safe' patrols in South Charlotte to target crime hotspots, expanding its safety initiative.
charlotte_impact: Increased police presence aims to deter crime and improve public safety in areas with high crime rates.

title: Union County Man Sentenced for Sexually Abusing Girl
summary: Maurice Limon Stitt, 42, received a lengthy prison sentence on Feb. 27, 2026, for sexually abusing a girl.
charlotte_impact: This case highlights the importance of protecting children from sexual abuse and holding perpetrators accountable.

title: Driver Kills Another in High-Speed Crash After Exiting I-77
summary: Joel Laron Smith, 21, is charged with reckless homicide after a high-speed crash killed another driver in Rock Hill.
charlotte_impact: This incident underscores the dangers of reckless driving and the importance of safe driving practices.

title: Man Arrested for Shooting Uncle Outside Dollar General in Stanley
summary: A man was arrested for shooting his uncle outside a Dollar General store on East Dallas Road in Stanley.
charlotte_impact: This shooting highlights the issue of gun violence and its impact on families and communities.

title: Waymo Self-Driving Cars Coming to Charlotte
summary: Waymo confirms its self-driving cars are coming to Charlotte, enabled by a 2017 law allowing autonomous vehicles.
charlotte_impact: The introduction of self-driving cars could revolutionize transportation and urban mobility in Charlotte.

title: Second Measles Case Confirmed in Union County
summary: Union County health officials confirm a second measles case in an unvaccinated child on Thursday, Feb. 26.
charlotte_impact: This case underscores the importance of vaccination to prevent the spread of infectious diseases, especially among children.

title: Debate Over Reopening Jail North Due to Price Gap
summary: Mecklenburg County juveniles are housed out of county as an $18 million price tag stalls reopening efforts for Jail North.
charlotte_impact: The debate highlights challenges in funding and managing juvenile detention facilities, impacting the justice system.

title: Tax Season Scams Rise as Refunds Grow
summary: Experts warn of fake IRS messages as tax refunds rise 14%, making taxpayers targets for scammers.
charlotte_impact: Increased tax refund amounts attract scammers, posing a risk to individuals' financial security and personal information.

title: Kannapolis Honors Corine Cannon with Bridge Designation
summary: Kannapolis leaders honor Corine Cannon, 106, for her involvement in the pursuit of justice in her community.
charlotte_impact: Recognizing community leaders like Corine Cannon celebrates their contributions and inspires others to engage in civic duties.
